Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: If anybody wants to suggest a stable-ish CC to be enabled in HUSH, now is the time

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
these are our current settings: ```
# CryptoConditions/Custom Consensus params
FAUCET=228
HEIR=234
CHANNEL=235
ORACLE=236
GATEWAY=241
CCENABLE=$FAUCET,$HEIR,$CHANNEL,$ORACLE,$GATEWAY
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Hush will have to do a forced update in a few weeks for new notaries, so we have a timeframe to make more updates soon

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i am just going to stick with the CC's that I have now. I will put Dilithium in the "to be enabled" category

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c you were so right saying "perfection is the enemy of completion", as you always seem to be. I went down a deep rabbit hole modifying code I shouldn't, and Alright set me straight

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I mined at least 10 testnets in the last 48hrs, and read parts of KMD internals I had never seen

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: learned how magicExtra sausage is made, that is fascinating

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and I learned how badly I could break the mining process by changing things I don't fully understand

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: HUSHv3 is still a source code fork, but it's very tiny and lean and protected by an `if AC==HUSH` guard

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I was able to merge 20K lines of diff this morning, `jl777/dev` into my `duke` branch of hush3, *with no merge conflicts* and I almost cried tears of joy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with the lag between CC being developed and it getting GUI and marketing, maybe being one year or more in many cases. any chain that specializes in maximizing any specific CC would end up being the showcase for that CC

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am hoping to attract some CC devs to the new HUSH chain, and I am very excited about the possibilities of Heir and Oracle and basically all of it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there are many unexplored avenues of HushList protocol + cryptoconditions, as well

Content: I can imagine a CC where unless a specific address sends funds to it regularly, information is released, maybe the privkey that unlocks memo fields, or a viewkey

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: dead man switch for whistleblowers

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i think a CC could inject a viewing key into OP_RETURN data, without touching zaddrs directly

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
https://github.com/KMDLabs/komodo/blob/lotto/src/cc/customcc.cpp
https://github.com/KMDLabs/komodo/blob/lotto/src/cc/customcc.h
This is my first attempt at making a CC from scratch, It changes a fair few things, and leverages the Verus Enhanced CCs with some changes I added myself, to make validation work. We havent tested this yet, but I hope to get a chain up on LABS as soon as I can. I tried to comment well, would be good if someone can have a look at this and let me know if there is something that needs clarifying, as I want people to understand how this works, so they can offer improvements to it. 
The one thing I dont like is that to make it work correctly, I needed to re purpouse the `version` integer in  `COptCCParams` to funcid. Really it should have both, or possibly, we can set version to 3, and maybe this will allow an extra integer to be added to the Class without beaking backwards compatibility.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ü§î  Just thaught of something, M is always 1, so maybe funcid can go there.
